term.title: puffing

item.text: An irreversible expansion of some carbon artifacts during graphitization heat treatment between 1650 and 2700 K.

notes.item: Puffing is caused by the release of heteroatoms, for instance sulfur atoms, from the coke in association with specific microstructural rearrangements.

sources.item: PAC, 1995, 67, 473. 'Recommended terminology for the description of carbon as a solid (IUPAC Recommendations 1995)' on page 502 (https://doi.org/10.1351/pac199567030473)
